programme.title: Animals with Cameras
programme.desc: In the heart of the Atlantic, Gordon joins a team looking to discover why huge numbers of devil rays, fish with `wings nearly four metres across, gather every summer near the Azores archipelago. In northeast Turkey cameras are carried by brown bears as part of a study trying to understand why so many bears survive in a small patch of forest. Meanwhile, in southern France, on-board cameras help scientists trying to prove that guard dogs can help protect sheep flocks from wolf attacks.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Members of the public try to make money from their antiques.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Yinka Bokinni, Ellie Leach, Vicki Michelle and Peter Serafinowicz test their general knowledge skills on this weeks House of Games.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
programme.desc: Fleur East is on hand with even more Movie Week behind-the-scenes action from the world of Strictly Come Dancing. Vicky Gill returns with a sneak peek of some blockbuster outfits. And more couples stop by with some showstopping dance exclusives.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotlands Rivers
programme.desc: Paul explores the upper reaches of the river Spey - Scotlands third longest river - from its source in the wilds of Badenoch to Broomhill, halfway down the river. He hears stories of clan chief Cluny Macpherson who hid with his gold for nine years.

programme.title: Sportscene LIVE
programme.sub-title: UEFA European Qualifiers, Group C: Scotland v Greece
programme.desc: Live coverage as Scotland host Greece in the World Cup qualifiers.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by banished and murdered celebrity players to discuss their time on the show - and to reveal the identity of the Traitors for the very first time...

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain
programme.desc: From playing computer games with chimpanzees to studying modern relationships, Jim Al-Khalili investigates how the brain evolved and how they differ from AI.

programme.title: Belfast
programme.desc: A semi-autobiographical film which chronicles the life of a working class family and their young sons childhood during the tumult of the late 1960s in the Northern Ireland capital.

programme.title: King and Conqueror
programme.desc: Harolds depleted English forces rush to meet Williams assault on the south coast. The resulting brutal battles outcome is unpredictable.

programme.title: How Are You? Its Alan (Partridge)
programme.sub-title: Im Still Alan Partridge (pka I Was Alan Partridge)
programme.desc: Leaving behind a lucrative career voicing radio commercials, Alan Partridge makes a bravely personal and personally brave return to television to make Britains first ever documentary about mental health.

programme.title: Banned in the 80s: Moments That Shook Music
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the untold stories behind the most controversial music of the 1980s, featuring Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Queen, George Michael, N.W.A, Madonna and others.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: The presenters take the prospective buyers around to different houses in the country. The desire for more room, cleaner air and less noise drives city dwellers to seek an escape to the country.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi uses her skills to honour a racing legend, and a mechanical doll needs the expert skills of toy restorers Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch.

programme.title: Michael Portillos 200 Years of the Rail
programme.desc: In this 200th year since the birth of the modern railway, train enthusiast and former politician Michael Portillo reveals how the first railways in Britain transformed the country.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Political Thinking with Nick Robinson
programme.desc: Nick Robinson has a conversation with, not an interrogation of, the people who shape our political thinking about what shaped theirs.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Thirty players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and sidekick Sarah Greene host the quiz show where contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor. Correct answers get the players moving, while wrong answers will stop them in their tracks.

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the quiz show where players face a question and pick from a board of six rankable answers. Some answers are good, but only one is unbeatable.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight finalists cook their fish courses to win a place on the menu of a banquet celebrating the Olympics and Paralympics. Champion weightlifter Emily Campbell, who won a silver in the Tokyo Olympics, joins the judging panel.

programme.title: Animals with Cameras
programme.desc: In Cape Verde, Gordon starts the adventure with a look at one of the worlds largest populations of nesting loggerhead turtles, before heading to the Bahamas with Caribbean reef sharks, California to see young elephant seals and the British Isles.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Today Flog It! comes from the Boconnoc estate in the Cornish countryside. Antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and Nick Hall uncover a pair of Georgian chairs and a childrens pedal fire engine.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Yinka Bokinni, Ellie Leach, Vicki Michelle and Peter Serafinowicz test their general knowledge skills on this weeks House of Games.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
programme.desc: Janette Manrara gets all the backstage gossip and behind-the-scenes action ahead of the weekends Strictly Movie Special. Also, shes joined by a panel of celebrity super fans casting their eyes over the upcoming big screen dances as the couples rehearse on the ballroom floor for the first time.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Ben Robinson discovers the impressive lime kilns in Solva, Wales. This picturesque 19th-century port is famous for producing quicklime, a vital ingredient in both agriculture and the building industry. The kilns here are well preserved and contributed to making the soil in farmers fields more alkaline, which helped to increase crop yield at a time when the nations population was growing. Its a pretty spot now, but Ben learns how this industry would have made life tough for the locals.

programme.title: UEFA European Qualifiers Football LIVE
programme.sub-title: Group A: Northern Ireland v Slovakia
programme.desc: Stephen Watson presents full match coverage from Windsor Park as Northern Ireland host Slovakia in the World Cup qualifiers. After a battling away display against four-time World Cup winners Germany, and three vital points earned in Luxembourg last month, Michael ONeills side return to Belfast in front of their passionate and expectant home support.

programme.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob venture from London to the Scottish Highlands, taking a sleeper train overnight to their destination. They wake in the stunning vista of north west Scotland, where the pine forests and snow-topped mountains almost take their breath away.

programme.desc: The kids get a chance to run Miss Skippys new food kiosk, where Mouse starts serving his own perfect chilli. Mouse adds his chilli to everything, possibly ruining Miss Skippys business completely.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy steals a magic statue that has the power to make objects appear in real life.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy propels the lemmings into the neighbouring hut of a sorcerer and a mysterious mask falls onto one of them, endowing him with the power of telekinesis.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: After spilling a milkshake during a delivery, SpongeBob vows to return and clean the entire building.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: With a spike in oddness in the UK, Department of Help agent Ozzie suggests they send for help from the best agent in the world.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Lights, Camera, Drac-tion! The Gang is thrust centre stage when Helsing swaps lives with Dracula for a reality show.

programme.title: Danny and Mick
programme.desc: Its ice cream for everyone when Danny and Mick take on an ice cream van.

programme.title: Bitesize: 9-11 Year Olds

programme.title: Wow Thats Amazing
programme.desc: Get ready for incredible experiments and mind-bending puzzles. Owain and Tilly are here to explore epic science tricks to try at home and showcase new technology innovations from around the world.

programme.title: Our School
programme.desc: A chance to meet some of the many different pets living with the students. Miss Robinson takes a doorstep tour in a mission to find out how much they know about all their animals.

programme.title: Go Get Arty
programme.desc: The Kwapongs take flight with stained-glass wings, Jill Scott MBE draws a footballing big cat, and Bristles gives the juicy lowdown on artist Giuseppe Arcimboldo.

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: Find out if super-sized anaconda Optimus Prime welcomes his new housemate. Tyler tries to out-jump a springy serval cat, and Amur leopard Xizi has a big operation.

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Oscar has lived most of his life in the Australian outback where he had an amazing time dirt biking, camping and playing outside. He and his family moved to Ayr a few years ago and while he has made good friends and likes living there, he misses his old outback life. He wants an Australia den so he can remember his hometown and where he can share his memories with his new friends.

programme.title: Absolute Genius Super Tech with Dick and Dom
programme.desc: Dick and Dom attempt to become superheroes by using technology to have superpowers. They reveal three geniuses whose inventions allow us to do the impossible, from breathing underwater to having superhuman strength and even extra limbs! Not only that, Dom becomes a real-life human wrecking ball.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: Mardy Mary Queen of Scots Special
programme.desc: This episode follows Mary Queen of Scots as she stumbles from young girl in Scotland to queen in France, back to queen in Scotland and finally to Elizabeth Is public enemy no 1. Meanwhile, across the world we meet silver-nosed Danish scientist Tycho Brahe.

programme.title: Our Black History Heroes
programme.desc: Tabitha tells the story of singer-songwriter and civil rights activist Nina Simone.

programme.title: Danny and Mick
programme.desc: Totally bonkers brothers Danny and Mick get into all sorts of cringe-tastic disasters while working together at the Pottsfield Leisure Centre.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Tyler needs to replace his missing dance crew. Andy and the band put their best feet forward but its a bit more choreography chaos than dancing distinction!

programme.title: Gladiators: Epic Pranks
programme.desc: Nitro pranks Apollo with fake influencer Aubry Devonne Keep, causing a big splash! And the other Gladiators have fun behind the scenes, pranking the audience at the Arena.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When Pesos patient, a remora fish, mysteriously disappears, the Octonauts enlist a unique undersea detective - a harbour seal.

programme.desc: Big Lizard and Cosima create a fantastic water ride when they dislodge an underwater rock blocking a volcanic vent. Its all good fun until they realise the sea is starting to change.

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: When Danger Mouse makes short work of Burt Badboy and his newly acquired band of fanatical feline followers, the groups leader Mandy and her cult of cats immediately become Danger Mouse worshippers.

programme.desc: Now that Freds leg has healed up, SpongeBob is determined to keep it safe, no matter what.

programme.title: Little Lunch
programme.desc: Competitive Tamara wants a fast partner with which to complete the walk-a-thon while the other kids just want good company.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Its Oswalds birthday! After running into a Party Crasher creature, there are suddenly four of him who seem identical.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Two aspiring warrior-heroes and a lively ghost girl refine the skills they need to take the place of an ageing monster-slayer by completing his odd, supernatural chores.

programme.title: Total DramaRama
programme.desc: Some of the original "Total Drama" characters enter into an alternate universe where they are aged down from teenagers to toddlers.

programme.title: Pokemon Horizons: The Series

programme.desc: Roy and Fuecoco make singing their strategy in a Tera Training usage test against Ryme.

programme.title: Winx Club: The Magic Is Back
programme.desc: Musas concert shines bright as dark forces plan their next dangerous move against Bloom.

programme.title: Gladiators: Epic Pranks
programme.desc: Nitro pranks Viper with a fake interview that ends with an unexpected splashdown, he doesnt find it funny! The other Gladiators have sneaky behind-the-scenes fun at Sheffield Arena.

programme.title: Andy and the Band
programme.sub-title: Rock Star School: Rock Star Magic
programme.desc: The band have less than an hour to put on the best show possible and save the school.

programme.title: Riders of Berk: Book of Dragons
programme.desc: Hiccup, Astrid, Fishlegs, Toothless and Gobber tell the legend behind the Book of Dragons and reveal insider training secrets about new, never-before-seen dragons. There are a total of fourteen dragons, each spread into seven classes.

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger the Tricarrotops explores the world of the crunchiest era, going on adventures throughout the colourful Vegesaur Valley.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing gets all his favourite games out to play with Charlie, but when Charlie arrives he doesnt want to play any of them. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie does want to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen - where he and Bing both have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa follow a trail of muddy footprints and find Po in bed with very muddy feet. The Noo-noo cleans off the mud.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea uses a remote control to drive Supertato to the far side of the supermarket.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its love and peace symbol Lychee performing his song `All You Need Is Lychee.

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Tomo is coming around for a playdate and Tee finds that waiting patiently for his friend to arrive is very difficult. Maybe Mos idea to build a lookout den will help pass the time.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing, Hoppity, his friends and their toys are playing superheroes in the park. When Bing and Hoppity rescue Flop from the giant spider, Bing falls off the climbing rope. He is alright, but Hoppity has had an accident: his bottom is broken! Sula, Pando and Flop help an upset Bing rescue Hoppity and then take him to Ammas, where she can sew him back together.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Red and Yellow sort different coloured objects onboard the Sorting Express. Learn to spot the difference between colours and shades with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: There are lots of laughs, and one of them, as the Squirrels find out, is very infectious!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Gerbie the snake is on holiday and would like to see all the beautiful sights. Duggee can help, he has his tour guide badge.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Luckys Dad is outraged that modern Pass the Parcel has a present in every layer and changes the rules back to only having one prize in the middle. As a result, Bingo is forever losing.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey, Bingo and Dad always take out the bins. Over a few weeks, Bingo tells Dad about a new kid at kindy who is mean to her and Mum offers some good advice.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.sub-title: Mountain Gorillas, The Democratic Republic of the Congo
programme.desc: When a cold-ridden Glitchs sneezing breaks his TV, the Grimbots take him to the Virunga National Park in the Democratic Republic of the Congo to see a real mountain gorilla. But Glitch doesnt realise how dangerous his cold germs can be, so the Go Jetters will have to stop him from making a baby gorilla sick - all while trying to keep it safe from dangerous traps left by hunters.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of the Old Browns New Roost
programme.desc: When Old Brown quits Owl Island in search of some peace and quiet, his new roost turns out to be a little too close to home for Peter, Lily and Benjamin!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above and Beyond
programme.desc: The Octonauts expand their exploration beyond the sea - and onto land. With new rides and new friends, they are prepared to protect any habitats and animals at risk on land or under the water.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: One needs to fix the space satellite to power up a special show.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: D is ready to rock - he has his drumsticks but nothing to bang on. With a little help from his friends, he tries a pan and a pin. How can he deliver his dazzling drum solo? This episode introduces the letter D and the words sat, pad, pan, pin, tap and din.

programme.title: Nick Copes Popcast
programme.desc: Nick and Norman get some help from a vampire bat called Valerie to write a Popcast song for their spooky party.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pups: Five Little Ducks
programme.desc: Mrs Weaver and the Penguins help reunite Mummy Duck with her babies as they sing Five Little Ducks.

programme.title: Playtime Towers
programme.desc: Its a hot day in Playtime Towers, so Bella helps Lift cool down with a paper fan. Together, they visit Hettie in the Ice Disco, who has a flapping paper fan dance!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bings friends are coming to his house for a cake party. Sula arrives first and Bing cant wait to show her the cake hes made, but he accidentally tips the cake off its stand and breaks it into pieces. Bing is upset that the cake is ruined but Amma helps him see it differently.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Yakka Dee! celebrates children communicating - because talking fills you up with whizz, pop, bang! In this episode, Dee encourages a friend to say bus and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of different buses - red, double-decker and bendy! We see Dee waiting for the bus and driving a bus in a picture on the wall.

programme.title: Lu and the Bally Bunch
programme.desc: Barnaby gives away some shared treats to Dermot, Dara and Declan without asking Lu.

programme.title: Piggy Builders
programme.desc: Brian sets up a treasure hunt with riddles for the Piggies, but Wilf hears about it and wants to get the treasure and keep it for himself.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos learn more and more when they watch a shopkeeper build up a display of apples. Back in the boat, the Twirlywoo Screen creates a tree which gives more and more bananas every time the Twirlywoos touch it.

programme.title: Something Special: Were All Friends
programme.desc: Theres a party, and everyone is invited. Justin and his friend arrange a disco party with a difference, while Mr Tumble holds his own disco party at Tumble Cottage.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies do running races and they each have a chance to win. When the Tubby Phone rings, theres a race to reach it before the tubby phone dance.

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome babies Layla, Betsy, Tobias, Amelia, Amber, Ferne, Ezra and their grown-ups. Inside everyones bags are sticks which are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby appropriate sticks inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby.

programme.title: Maddie and Triggs
programme.desc: Maddie accidentally breaks a piece of pottery that Mum made, but instead of doing the right thing and owning up, she starts to worry about how bad everything will now go!

programme.title: Dylans Playtime Adventures
programme.desc: Dylan the pizza delivery pup wants to deliver a pizza fast, but every shortcut is an adventure.

programme.title: Kiri and Lou
programme.desc: Kiri and Lou want to meet Dalvanius, who is very good at camouflage. He says hell only reveal himself if they promise not to laugh at his ears.

programme.title: Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger the Tricarrotops explores the world of the crunchiest era, going on adventures throughout the colourful Vegesaur Valley.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey, Bingo and Mum play Keepy-Uppy around the house with their last balloon, but it becomes competitive when Dad joins in.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels see Duggee reading about wise animals and wish to learn more about what it means to be wise.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Catchmen land on the planet Bounce, where they befriend some alien children and bounce together on every surface.

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its the daring Orange attempting to cross the stage on a tightrope, if she manages to ignore any distractions.

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: Its Halloween and Timmy and his friends are having lots of spooky fun, hollowing out pumpkins and making party decorations. Timmy and Finlay cant resist playing tricks on their friends, but when they hear some scary noises in the Outhouse, the tables are turned.

programme.title: Our Family
programme.sub-title: Iona and Elbas Wizardy Windy Day
programme.desc: Magic is in the air as Mum has a wizarding surprise waiting for Iona and Elba in the garden. Later, the whole family head out to launch their kite in the windy sky.

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Jenae is cooking her favourite meal of Jamaican saltfish and cabbage. Her family are Jamaican, and in Jamaica saltfish and cabbage is a very popular meal. Lots of people eat it for their breakfast, but Jenae is cooking it as a very special dinner for her friends. She is using saltfish, fresh cabbage and colourful peppers in her meal. Jenaes friends have mixed opinions about the taste of fresh green pepper. She hopes that they will like it cooked in her recipe.

programme.title: Ferne and Rorys Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Maisie finds out all about some very busy creatures - honeybees. Chantelle meets some of CBBCs Show Me the Honey team, Darcey Mae and Curtis, as they show her the inside of a hive, while Rory and his son Sandy get an unusual view of a busy hive.

programme.title: Whats in Your Bag?
programme.desc: Wildlife photographer Lara shows how she uses her camera trap to take photos of animals in the wild when shes not there.

programme.title: Time for School
programme.sub-title: A Toy Tiger Comes to School
programme.desc: Lucas and his classmates are learning to write the letter t for tiger. After watching how its done by Mrs Collins, Lucas helps his friend Otto. The children discover the classroom is in a mess and a spot tiger paw print on the floor. Could it be a toy tiger causing havoc in the school? Lucas has an idea to track down the toy tiger - leaving out pictures and some food - but will it work?

programme.title: Graces Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace shows off three amazing machines that were made to help people in emergencies. Grace puts out a real fire in an airport fire engine, shows off amazing search-and-rescue helicopters, and drives an ambulance.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say cow and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of cows! Theres a big cow and a baby cow, a brown cow and a black and white cow. We meet a swishy-tailed cow, a furry cow, a muddy cow and even a fairy cow!

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: One of the bottles in Tens collection accidentally falls off the wall, setting off a spectacular numbery hullabaloo. Learn to count down from ten by taking one away with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: The Alphablocks meet a metal box that goes beep, and soon its walking and talking and wishing it could be like its new friends.

programme.title: Wonderblocks
programme.desc: Wonderblock Stop is Gos new best friend. Stop likes to stop and think things through. When Go gets her ball stuck in a tree, Stop encourages her to pause for a moment to find a way to retrieve it.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Brown takes the Colourblocks exploring in the forest. Learn different ways to mix brown with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are struggling to build the Clubhouse out of building blocks. It keeps falling over! Duggee explains that the Squirrels need to be a bit of an Architect to create buildings that dont fall down.

programme.title: Yukee
programme.desc: Twinkle discovers an army of marching ants taking seeds from her vegetable garden. When all attempts to stop them fail, she and Yukee try to find a way to get the ants marching to a different beat and away from her garden.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin visits a friends school to make a recycled dragon and to take part in a dragon parade. Meanwhile, its school photo day with Teacher Tumble - say cheese!

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Po makes lots of silly, funny sounds with the levers and buttons in Home Dome and then the Tubby Phone rings for a silly tubby phone dance.

programme.title: Andys Safari Adventures
programme.desc: When Jen accidentally destroys a video of an Arctic fox, Andy takes to the skies in his safari-mobile and heads to the Arctic to re-record the action on his gizmo. But a hungry polar bear and a snowstorm thwart his every move. Can Andy record a new video of the Arctic fox before Mr Hammond notices the old one was destroyed?

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle has so much fun on a doggy playdate at Mr Willows house that he decides to stay for a sleepover! The Brooklyn-Bells miss Waffle and cant wait for his return.

programme.title: Topsy and Tim
programme.desc: Topsy is feeling much better, but shes bored of resting and theres nothing fun she can do! So when she hears DIY Derek next door and his new little dog Teddy, shes really excited and plays with Teddy. Later, Grandma phones to say her dog, Mossy, isnt feeling very good, so Mummy and Topsy go to Grandmas, taking one of Teddys snacks, Topsys vet set and a tennis ball with them. When Topsy shows Mossy the tennis ball, Mossy wags her tail and cheers up!

programme.title: Raa Raa the Noisy Lion
programme.desc: The animals are playing hide and seek. Huffty gets upset when his trunk keeps giving him away. Raa Raa and his friends try to show the little elephant that his trunk is really rather wonderful.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Game Catchers land on a planet covered in rivers and lakes that are made of fruit juice! Here, they learn the hoop game, but things get complicated when Multi loses control of his hoop.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Running out of air, Barnacles struggles to free his paw from the mouth of a giant clam, while simultaneously directing his crew in a delicate manatee rescue operation.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of the Great Breakout
programme.desc: When Mr McGregor captures the whole squirrel tribe in his garden, Peter must stage a mass breakout to save his friends.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is going to make the Squirrels juice from fresh fruit in the garden. Whilst picking the fruit, the Squirrels meet a little bug, full of woes about being too small. The Squirrels think it must be brilliant to be so tiny but the little bug disagrees.

programme.title: Vida the Vet
programme.desc: When Fergie gets hiccups right before singing with her band, she calls on Vida for a quick preshow cure. None of Vidas tricks works, but she knows what will - Fergie needs to get scared. And, luckily for Fergie, she gets stage fright!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea befriends the playful but destructive Baby Watermelon to destroy Tato Tower.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard find some fascinatingly slippery fruit, but bringing it safely back to the ship is more challenging than they imagined!

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Mojo and Bo need Teds help to pull a wobbly duck statue up Swoppiton Hill. But does Ted know the best way? And will there be anything left of the duck when they get there?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Luckys Dad is outraged that modern Pass the Parcel has a present in every layer and changes the rules back to only having one prize in the middle. As a result, Bingo is forever losing.

programme.desc: The Piris take refuge in grumpy Millie the squids cave during a storm but accidentally damage a painting. Can they find a clever way to fix it before Millie finds out?

programme.title: Dodges Pup School
programme.desc: Woofer builds his own spaceship after reading a book about outer space.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: The Essam family visit the Brooklyn-Bells. Jess hopes their well-behaved dog, Baxter, will teach Waffle how to be good, but Waffle has other ideas.

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: When Oona and Baba go to collect some flowers for Mama and Papa they see more bees than they bargained for.

programme.title: JoJo and Gran Gran
programme.sub-title: - Autumn:Its Time to Look for Signs
programme.desc: On the way home from Jareds shop with Gran Gran, JoJo finds out about the signs around them and what they mean. They are everywhere, and they all have a job to do. When they get home, Gran Gran has a plan to help JoJo make some signs of her own - there are even some special ones that they can share with Jared.

programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, Colly Wobble has lost her shoes. In Storyland, Moon Baby shows Colly Wobble a magical shoe tree with different shoes growing on it. Colly Wobble tries the Wellington Boots. What a lot of splishy-sploshy fun!

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: As the air grows cold, a crystal-shaped seed lands on the Clangers planet. Granny helps Tiny to plant it, and it quickly grows into a wonderful crystal tree. Other seeds fall, and soon there is a small forest of them. Mother Clanger has heard that these amazing trees can sparkle and glow, but none of the Clangers know how this is done - until completely by accident, Tiny discovers that music is the answer.

programme.sub-title: The Pontipine Children on the Roof
programme.desc: The Pontipines ride on the Ninky Nonk but Mr and Mrs Pontipine cant find the children. It turns out those naughty dollies are riding on the roof of the Pontipine carriage.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as James, Gaye, Paul and Gemma join forces in the hope of winning thousands of pounds. All theyve got to do is beat the Chaser.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Four strangers work as a team to answer general knowledge questions. They must defeat the Chaser, a ruthless quiz genius, in order to win money.

programme.title: The Chase

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Edinburgh, Kirstie helps Sadia and Sohail break the shackles of flat-living, while Phils with Freya and Elliot, who are set on exclusive enclaves - in a fast-moving market.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: From the discovery of the old 19th-century wash house to the pepper pot tower library, we revisit some of the Strawbridges best moments at the chateau from series seven of the show.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: In Cumbria George meets Harry who wants to transplant a derelict Victorian railway signal box to his home and turn it into a garden summerhouse. In Derby, 22-year-old wood carver Sophie hopes to transform a VW campervan into a mobile home.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Maggie Aderin-Pocock in Dictionary Corner. Contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug reluctantly agrees to invest his Christmas bonus in an online business., and Arthur tries to outdo the neighbours big wreath.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Dougs cousin Danny has no best man for his marriage, so Doug reluctantly fills in and arranges a bachelor party. Unfortunately Danny doesnt seem to have many friends who want to come.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug arranges a reunion for his high school football team, but is angry when his championship-winning block is attributed to his team-mate Tom, who is now in a wheelchair.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra decides she and Ray should go to see a marriage counsellor. Although Ray is completely against the idea, he quickly changes his attitude when they meet the therapist, Pamela, who instantly takes a liking to him.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Allys teacher, Miss Purcell, overhears Ray commenting about the kids excessive workload, she invites Raymond to address the curriculum review board and gives him a mountain of material for review.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Even though his father is very much alive and well, Ray writes a eulogy for him that winds up in the wrong hands.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: When a Man Loves Two Women
programme.desc: Just as Frasier overcomes his fears about his relationship with Cassandra, Faye returns and upsets the balance in his life.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne becomes engaged to her boyfriend Donny but her excitement is cut short by a psychic vision which seems to suggest that he is not the right man for her. Knowing that Frasier is scathing about her psychic powers, she seeks advice from a more sympathetic source: Niles.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphnes engagement to Donny has Niles in a slump, but Peppy from Cafe Nervosa provides a pick me up, Frasier finds himself focusing on Faye, but he keeps saying `Cassandra, and Martins relationship with Bonnie goes to the dogs.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasier jeopardises his relationship by accidentally calling his girlfriend by an ex-lovers name, and Daphne panics after losing a valuable keepsake.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Three previously featured bosses ask employees to go under cover for a second look inside their organisations.

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Channel 4s midday news summary.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Italy a BandB opens its doors to test guests, while in Spain a woman takes her coach trippers on a catamaran. In France, a family struggle to get a gite renovated, and a couple in Spain find their bar and BandB business seriously short of staff.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole, Simon OBrien and Max McMurdo travel across the UK to find unique items lost in peoples homes to fix up for a profit. Henry finds a tractor which hasnt run for years.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Maggie Aderin-Pocock in Dictionary Corner. Contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Theres delicate demolition at Jonas and Ulrikes village, as a dilapidated church organ gets a makeover. And strict Brexit rules threaten to derail Kates Bulgarian dream.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Martial arts expert Dan hosts the weeks final visit in Southport, where he aims to please with his no-nonsense approach to a classic seaside getaway. The bed and breakfast owners seem less positive about some cleanliness issues.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bristol, Stance serves a taste of his Lebanese-Persian heritage, and mums the word for the second time this week!

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: George Clarkes Homes in the Wild
programme.desc: On New Zealands remote Rakino Island, George explores the off-grid enchantment of a one-of-a-kind home and a house so close to the ocean that the tide feels like a front doorstep.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Ania Magliano asks a stranger about their marital status, Phil Ellis strips to his base layer and Reece Shearsmith destroys a valuable ornament. Throughout it all, Greg Davies expertly maintains order with his usual stern authority.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its Pastry Week... lets hope for no soggy bottoms! Savoury plaits are on the menu, but who will have the judges tongue-tied? And whose gala pie will be their final goodbye?

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon helps out at Jacks Waterfront in St. Clair Shores, Mich., a lakeside restaurant in a popular summer spot.

programme.title: In Flames
programme.desc: After the death of the family patriarch, a mother and daughters precarious existence is ripped apart. They must find strength in each other to survive the malevolent forces that threaten to engulf them.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien revamp and repurpose hidden treasures. They find an electric organ and a vintage oil dispenser in Maggies barns, which are brimming with junk.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie meets Hannah and John Sherlock in Shrewsbury, and Phil is with professional musicians Mesha and Darren, looking to buy their first home together in Wolverhampton.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets a couple in Worcestershire who have taken the plunge and given up the rat race, selling their town house to buy some land in the country.

programme.title: Countdown

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Arthur moves upstairs because his cellar gets too cold in the winter. Doug doesnt like it and waits eagerly for warmer weather, but Arthur does not seem to want to move back.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug is appalled when he finds out Carrie frequently cheats at board games. She tries to get better but maybe the reason behind her behaviour needs to be found out first.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie and Doug reminisce about how they first met, remembering that it certainly wasnt love at first sight.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray starts to think hes having an identity crisis since he no longer enjoys his juvenile pursuits with his friends.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: After deciding to lend Robert $1,000 when he complains hes struggling with his finances, Ray and Debra are surprised when Robert uses the money for a vacation to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debras tired of sharing all her space with Ray, so he decides to give her exclusive use of their bathroom while he shares the kids.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: While Frasier and Roz are in the coffee shop waiting for Frasiers blind date to turn up, he finds himself entranced by a woman sitting next to them. Plucking up the courage to speak with her, he succeeds in getting a date. Meanwhile, Martin prepares for his fishing weekend with his sons at the log cabin they stayed at when they were younger. When they arrive at the cabin, they meet the woman who has sent Frasiers pulse racing.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasier turns Daphnes simple wedding into a lavish affair, and Niles doesnt realise that his new girlfriend is a prostitute and enjoys documenting the time they spend together.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: An on-air contest by the stations `shock-jocks urges listeners to photograph a vengeful Frasiers backside.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasier, jealous over Niles job as an art critic, schemes to get the same position at the radio station.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jeff Platt, president and CEO of entertainment and fitness business Sky Zone, a chain of indoor trampoline parks, goes undercover in his own company posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition who is trying to win an action-adventure holiday.

programme.desc: Channel 4s midday news summary.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A familys renovated French gite springs several leaks. In Spain, back-to-back BandB bookings and a busy bar leave a couple run off their feet. Lesley hopes a coach trip to a tomato throwing festival will prove fruitful for her Spanish tour company.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Karen and Brian are taking the leap and following their dream of making a permanent move to the Málaga province in southern Spain. Leah Charles-King shows them what their £120k can buy.

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: In France, after three years of hard work, Lolly and Sean dig deep to finish their once-abandoned manoir, while an army of workers battle to restore Dans fire-damaged château. Jonas and Ulrike aim to resurrect Romanias oldest Saxon era churches.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Two hosts decide upon an all-guns-blazing approach to payment day, knowing well that they have vastly underpaid everyone. With allegations of game playing, it is quite the tension-filled affair.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bristol, can Georges restaurant standard food and cheeky menu floor his guests and bag him the grand?

programme.desc: In Alicante, Damon and Sophie help Sheffield sparky Mark get close to the coast. Meanwhile, away from the office, Manuel embarks on a quest for the perfect ham sandwich.

programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off: An Extra Slice
programme.desc: Alison Hammond, Jonathan Ross and Joe Thomas digest Pastry Week. Whose Technical got pied, and whose Signature plaits had the judges tongue-tied?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britains sharpest armchair critics share more of their sharp, insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of the weeks biggest and best shows on television.

programme.title: Mitchell and Webb Are Not Helping
programme.desc: The real cause of climate change? Its good news and bad news. Plus: TVs most wholesome heirloom repair show. A death in the Sweary Aussie family. And the lawyers intervene in the writers room.

programme.title: Greg Davies: The Back of My Mums Head
programme.desc: Stung by his mothers suggestion that he is not normal, Greg puts everyone else under the microscope in a petty quest to discover if anyone actually is.

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Thoroughly Modern Millican Live
programme.desc: Award-winning `Queen of Comedy, Sarah Millican presents her live stand-up show recorded at the Hammersmith Apollo, London. Sarah tells gag-packed anecdotes about lifes humdrum curiosities. Ever wondered how to make a homemade treadmill, or the reasons for carrying spare pants and the practicalities of an orgy?

programme.title: Crush
programme.desc: When a young artist is forced to join her high school track team, she uses it as a chance to pursue the girl for whom shes been harbouring a crush. But she finds herself falling for an unexpected teammate and discovering what real love feels like.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay heads to Cranbury, N.J., to help two friends who bought a French Bistro they used to work in; a disgusting discovery in a kitchen cooler forces Ramsay to shut the restaurant down on the busiest night of the year.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George travels to Macclesfield to visit a first time builder who hopes to transform an allotment shed into a Doctor Who-style, multi-functional play den.

programme.title: Ungli
programme.desc: The story of the Ungali Gang, a group of friends who launch a moral crusade against corrupt police officers and people in power.

programme.title: ACP Shiva
programme.desc: Shivakumar, a dishonest cop, ensures that he is transferred to Chennai, where he exploits his position for financial gain. He also supports GK, a local MP, against the commissioner of Chennai.

programme.title: Kachcha Chor
programme.desc: A criminal joins an NGO that looks at societal reform on the behest of a social worker. This brings about changes in his behaviour and attitude.

programme.desc: A street-smart newly recruited chauffeur partners with his late employers wife to pocket a hefty insurance claim.

programme.title: Yeh Lamhe Judaai Ke
programme.desc: A successful singer and his childhood friends become entangled in deception and treachery.

programme.title: Raja Hindustani
programme.desc: A young womans wealthy family objects to her romance with a destitute taxi driver, and try their best to break them up.

programme.title: Brothers
programme.desc: Two estranged, street-fighting brothers square off against each other in a mixed martial arts tournament.

programme.title: Cinebuzz

programme.title: Stree 2: Sarkate Ka Aatank
programme.desc: The town of Chanderi is being haunted again. This time, women are mysteriously abducted by a terrifying headless entity. Once again, it is up to Vicky and his friends to save their town and loved ones.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Phenix Salon Inc founder Gina Rivera must complete a pedicure and a straight-razor shave while undercover.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon travels to Philadelphia to visit a Mexican restaurant called Zocalo. At one point, this restaurant played Cupid to a young couple who met, fell in love and married while working here together. Greg and Mary Russell loved the place so much that they pooled their resources and bought it. However, it seems that Cupids arrow had a poisoned tip: the restaurant has become an albatross around their necks.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Fremont, California, to try to save a restaurant that is tearing the owners marriage apart. Saki Kavouniaris took over the failing Spin-a-Yarn restaurant in 1995 and began to turn it into a success. He fell in love with a waitress, but the restaurant and the marriage are now failing.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon travels to Oakhurst, New Jersey, to help Mike Farber, the overwhelmed owner of Mike and Nellies restaurant, who lost his way when Nellie, his father and business partner, died. Opened in 1996, the restaurant was a lifelong dream for the father and son. Alone at the helm, and still mourning the loss of his father, Mike has taken his eye off the ball and the restaurant has gone to pot.

programme.title: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Capt. Sandy welcomes back a charter guest with high expectations; a deckhand and a guest drift too far away at sea, leaving Capt. Sandy questioning her bosun; the primary charter guest complains the food has not met their expectations.

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: Lavish rendering of Winston Churchills early life, from his school days, through his adventures in Africa, to his first days in Parliament. It begins with Churchill as a junior officer in India out to make a name for himself. It is suggested that becoming a war correspondent would be a good career move. His colourful, often controversial, reports make him a household name, aiding his passage into politics.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A lovable Catholic priest sets out to retrieve the priceless cross stolen by a thief named Flambeau during a trip to Rome. However, Father Brown is not an ordinary churchman, and the thief meets his match.

programme.title: Time Lock
programme.desc: Modest in scale only, this gripping rescue drama reeks of sweat-soaked claustrophobia and suspense. Peter Dawson heads a team of experts, doctors and welders racing against the clock to save a six-year-old boy whos been trapped in a seemingly impregnable bank vault.

programme.title: The Black Arrow
programme.desc: Richard Shelton returns victorious from the War of the Roses only to discover that his father has been murdered.

programme.title: Hunter Killer
programme.desc: American submarine Captain Joe Glass is on the hunt for a U.S. sub in distress in the Arctic Ocean. He soon learns that a secret Russian coup is in the offing, a conspiracy that threatens to dismantle the world order. With crew and country on the line, Glass must assemble an elite group of Navy SEALs to sneak through enemy waters, rescue the kidnapped Russian president and prevent World War III.

programme.title: A Few Good Men
programme.desc: A young and impetuous naval lieutenant and a more experienced officer are given the job of defending two marines accused of murder. As the two officers come to terms with one another, their investigation uncovers some sinister secrets and collusion at the highest level. The marines commanding officer certainly has no intention of making the truth public.

programme.title: Overlord
programme.desc: Paratroopers drop behind enemy lines to penetrate a fortified church and destroy a Nazi transmitter. Making their way to an underground lab, the soldiers stumble upon a sinister experiment that forces them into a battle against an army of the undead.

programme.title: I Am Not a Witch
programme.desc: Shula is the first child taken to a travelling witch camp, where she is told that should she cut the ribbon and attempt to escape, she will be cursed and transformed into a goat.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In France, theres a new arrival at the alpaca farm. In Spain, there are security problems at the padel tennis club, and at the rock n roll BandB, theres finally water in the pool.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A farm in France try alpaca yoga, while a couple from Sussex renovate their gîtes. In Spain, storms wreck a padel tennis tournament, and the rock n roll BandB opens its doors.

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Alison and Zion have digger troubles as they unearth giant rocks in the wedding garden. The heat is on for Sasha as she attempts to paint a mural on the pool cover before it dries out. Tim and Luke transform an old storage space into a games room.

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Becky and Mark battle to get their new gîte ready ahead of 50 guests arriving for an open day. Temperatures rise for Sarah and George as they host a wedding during a heatwave. Zion creates a spectacular steam room in the bridal suite bathroom.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich in Kent, hosts Jan and Les Fisher are convinced that their traditional place will impress their guests, but Robert is bent on revenge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Roberts arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the final day in the competition, the owners meet to find out what theyve been paid. Theres harsh criticism, accusations of play-acting, and even tears.

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz head to Norfolk where a sporty French hot hatch awaits. The car belongs to student Senna, who comes from a family of petrol heads.

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz are picking up one of Frances most legendary rally racers: a 1972 Renault Alpine 110. The car belongs to former restaurateur Guido.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Wanting to create a stunning honeymoon suite, Angel asks Dick to smash a hole in the three-feet-thick castle wall.

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Flatmates Mercedes and Jason must decide between Catahoula pups Brynn and Bristol. Correan and son Rocco figure out whether Vada, a cattle-bull mastiff cross, is right for them.

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Rocky the bulldog has had a much-needed facelift for his date, but only has eyes for a toy avocado. Muddy puddle enthusiast Grady the lurcher is looking for a new thrill.

programme.title: Great Estates from Above
programme.desc: Brand new series: This breathtaking series uses state-of-the-art drone photography to explore Britains country estates, beginning with Blenheim Palace and its gardens and woodland.

programme.title: The Shape of Water
programme.desc: Elisa is a mute, isolated woman who works as a cleaning lady in a hidden, high-security government laboratory in 1962 Baltimore. Her life changes forever when she discovers the labs classified secret -- a mysterious, scaled creature from South America that lives in a water tank. As Elisa develops a unique bond with her new friend, she soon learns that its fate and very survival lies in the hands of a hostile government agent and a marine biologist.

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Featuring the St Georges specialist stroke team who treat more than 1200 stroke patients every day. Meanwhile, Steven has severe stomach cramps, and 16-year-old Aaliyahs fingernail has been badly damaged in a fight.

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Exploring selflessness and sacrifice as two families experience life-changing events. Junior, whos eight, has been knocked off his bike. He has a leg fracture and suspected internal bleeding. Meanwhile, Anthony has a dangerously high heart rate.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Chris suffers multiple injuries after a quad bike accident near Penrith. Cyclist Vivienne is in a bad way after her bike leaves a notorious Cumbrian pass.

Raj makes some big finds in one of the tiniest shops of the trip and pins his hopes on a risky item that may or may not be highly collectable.

programme.title: The Derbyshire Auction House
programme.desc: Irita Marriott, one of the few women in the country to helm an auction house, and her team use their expertise to launch Britains newest saleroom.

programme.desc: Its the penultimate leg with road tripping auctioneers and good friends Natasha Raskin Sharp and Philip Serrell. Their tour of Scotland continues in East Ayrshire and Dumfries and Galloway.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Yorkshire Air 999

programme.desc: The team treat a man who has crashed his car into the back of a bin lorry. Plus, a cyclist suffers a high-speed crash after her tyre burst.

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Comic-book adventure about a stunt motorcyclist tricked into making a pact with Mephistopheles. The rider can only escape doing the demons bidding if he agrees to battle the dark lords son. To this end, he assumes the identity of the supernatural Ghost Rider, a terrifying night-time vigilante with a flaming skull.

programme.desc: Johnny Blaze gets a chance to rid himself of the Ghost Rider curse forever when members of a secret church hire him to save a boy from Satan.

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: On his return from the Crusades, Robin of Locksley learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect King Richards throne. Fight scenes are lively and inventive, and a set piece fought under the forest canopy pulls out all the stops.

programme.desc: While driving with his two kids, a man receives a phone call from an unknown assailant who claims there is a bomb in the car. Unable to exit the vehicle, he must now follow a series of twisted instructions while trying to figure out how to survive.

programme.desc: Looking for the days when he felt like a `real ogre, shrek makes an ill advised pact with Rumpelstiltskin. Banished to a Shrek-less version of the land of Far Far Away, the unfortunate ogre must once again win the love of Princess Fiona if hes to ever get back home.

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: Draculas spell turns a woman and her loved ones into a vampire, a mummy, a werewolf and Frankensteins monster.

programme.title: Dr. Seuss the Lorax
programme.desc: A young boy searches for a way to gain the affections of his dream-girl. In his quest he learns that in order to succeed he must uncover the story of the grumpy but nature-loving Lorax.

programme.desc: A pig, a mouse, a porcupine, a gorilla, an elephant and other animals gather at a koalas theatre for a singing competition.

programme.title: Mavka: The Forest Song
programme.desc: Young and naive forest spirit Mavka, develops feelings for a human musician, Lukas. As they grow closer to each other, an inevitable situation forces Mavka to choose between her love and her duty as a guardian of the forest.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Dracula, who operates a high-end resort away from the human world, goes into overprotective mode when a boy discovers the resort and falls for the counts teen-aged daughter.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: Concerned that his half-human grandson isnt showing his vampire side, Dracula and his friends put the boy through a `monster-in-training boot camp just as Dracs old-school father decides to pay a visit.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation
programme.desc: Mavis surprises Dracula with plans for a fun-filled summer voyage on a monster cruise. As the pack starts enjoying colossal buffets and exotic excursions, Drac finds himself falling for the ships intriguing but dangerous captain. He soon learns that trying to balance family, friends and romance might just be too much to handle. even for the worlds most powerful vampire.

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Mechs vs. Mutants
programme.desc: Gotham City faces catastrophe when Mr Freeze transforms Killer Croc and Bane into mega-sized mutant monsters. As the gigantic villains go on the rampage, its up to the caped crusader to cut them down to size.

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: A pig, a mouse, a porcupine, a gorilla, an elephant and other animals gather at a koalas theatre for a singing competition.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: Scott Pilgrim plays bass guitar in a struggling Toronto-based band and pines after his ex-girlfriend, now a success in her own band. At a party he meets Ramona Flowers and instantly is smitten, but in his pursuit of her he is attacked by Matthew Patel who informs Scott that he is the first of seven evil exes that Scott will have to defeat in order to win Ramona.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Saturday Night
programme.desc: To celebrate the release of the film Saturday Night, join the Cinema List as we explore 50 years of hilarious films from the SNL cast - including Waynes World, Bridesmaids and more.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Deeds is much-loved in his small town, but following the death of a long-lost uncle, who also happens to be a billionaire tycoon, Deeds inherits a fortune and heads for the big city to run his uncles company. When a media frenzy ensues surrounding Deeds inheritance, reporter Babe Bennett goes undercover to out Deeds as the small-town fool she thinks he is.

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Video game experts are recruited by the military to fight 1980s-era video game characters whove attacked New York.

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: An over-protective dad, determined to do a better job than his own distant father, anxiously dotes on his troubled eight-year-old son. His brother, meanwhile, strives to mould his toddler daughter into an academic high-flyer, and his sister struggles with two rebellious, angst-ridden teenagers.

programme.title: Rumours
programme.desc: Leaders of the worlds wealthiest democracies become spectacles of incompetence, contending with increasingly surreal obstacles as night falls in the misty woods and they realise they are suddenly alone.

programme.title: You, Me and Dupree
programme.desc: Carl is in seventh heaven when he marries his gorgeous girlfriend Molly in Hawaii. After a blissful honeymoon, they get back to find best man Dupree jobless, penniless and homeless. When Carl offers him a place to crash, he has no idea of the havoc that the blonde bum is about to cause.

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: Nick, Dale and Kurt all despise their bosses, but who would be crazy enough to quit their jobs in such poor economic times? The trio drunkenly and hypothetically discuss how to kill their bosses, and before they know it, theyve hired a murder consultant to help them pull off the three deeds.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: Youve Got Mail
programme.desc: Two rival bookstore owners are unaware that they are conducting a secret romance with each other on the Internet. When they discover the truth, they must prevent their business rivalry from interfering with their growing personal intimacy.

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: Video game experts are recruited by the military to fight 1980s-era video game characters whove attacked New York.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: The Men Who Stare at Goats
programme.desc: A reporter in Iraq may just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the US Armys New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Saturday Night
programme.desc: To celebrate the release of the film Saturday Night, join the Cinema List as we explore 50 years of hilarious films from the SNL cast - including Waynes World, Bridesmaids and more.

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: Rachel Chu is happy to accompany her longtime boyfriend, Nick, to his best friends wedding in Singapore. Shes also surprised to learn that Nicks family is extremely wealthy and hes considered one of the countrys most eligible bachelors. Thrust into the spotlight, Rachel must now contend with jealous socialites, quirky relatives and something far, far worse: Nicks disapproving mother.

programme.title: Twins
programme.desc: Two very different twin brothers were born as a result of a genetic experiment. Following their birth, the flawless Julius grew up on a paradise island, while the less-than-perfect Vincent was sent to an orphanage. Now, many years later, Vincent is a thief and con man with huge debts. What will Julius think when he searches for his long-lost twin and finds him in jail?

programme.title: Its Complicated
programme.desc: When attending their sons college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. However, the complication lies in the fact that they are divorced and he has remarried.

programme.title: Bad Teacher
programme.desc: A rude, drug-abusing educator vies with a perky colleague for the attentions of a rich and handsome substitute teacher.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor
programme.desc: Professor Sherman, a 450lb scientist, falls for his new colleague Professor Carla Purty, but out on a date, hes humiliated by a nightclub comedian about his weight. Upset and depressed, he takes a potion hes only tested previously on hamsters and - hey presto - he turns into a svelte and cool-talking babe-magnet, Buddy Love.

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Sherman is getting married to Denise Gains but his alter-ego Buddy Love keeps breaking through. Determined to rid himself of his pesky partner, he extracts Buddys genes, but an accident and a dog hair see Buddy take on his own life. Unaware of his existence, Sherman and Denise perfect their new rejuvenation formula and their fortune seems assured until Buddy steals it.

programme.title: Beetlejuice Beetlejuice
programme.desc: Still haunted by Beetlejuice, Lydias life gets turned upside down when her daughter discovers a portal to the afterlife. When someone says Beetlejuices name three times, the mischievous demon soon returns to unleash his very own brand of mayhem.

programme.title: Two Weeks Notice
programme.desc: An ambitious law graduate decides to leave her job as she feels her skills are not appreciated by her boss, who basically treats her like his PA. However, he wont let her go that easily.

programme.title: 50 First Dates
programme.desc: Playboy vet Henry sets his heart on romancing Lucy, but she has short-term memory loss; she cant remember anything that happened the day before. So every morning, Henry has to woo her again. Her friends and family are very protective, and Henry must convince them that hes in it for love.

programme.title: Kangaroo Jack
programme.desc: Two childhood friends get caught up in with the mob in New York and find themselves forced to travel to Australia to deliver $50,000. Their trouble really starts when they reach the outback, and a kangaroo bounds away with the cash.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: The continuing adventures of the Portokalos family. A follow-up to the 2002 comedy, My Big Fat Greek Wedding.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood
programme.desc: Ruthless silver miner, turned oil prospector, Daniel Plainview moves to oil-rich California. Using his adopted son HW to project a trustworthy, family-man image, Plainview cons local landowners into selling him their valuable properties for a pittance. However, local preacher Eli Sunday suspects Plainviews motives and intentions, starting a slow-burning feud that threatens both their lives.

programme.title: Funny Girl
programme.desc: Based on the true story of Fanny Brice, who rose from obscurity to become one of Americas most beloved entertainers.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: Whilst on leave, a Marine falls in love with a college student. The long-distance relationship is then tested when the Marine decides to re-enlist post-9/11.

programme.title: Darkest Hour
programme.desc: With the German Army now just across the Channel, newly-appointed Prime Minister Winston Churchill must decide between negotiating a peace treaty with Hitler or standing firm. With the King, the public and his own political party all questioning his wisdom, the hard-drinking Churchill has to survive his own darkest hour and rally the country behind him.

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: When his fathers job results in a family move to the countryside, young German boy Bruno misses his old friends. Roaming the grounds of the large country house he now calls home, he discovers the huge fenced facility that his dad Ralf, a Nazi officer, now manages. Approaching it, Bruno meets Shmuel, a fellow youngster on the other side of the barbed wire, wearing what appears to be a pair of pyjamas.

programme.title: Luckiest Man In America
programme.desc: An ice-cream truck driver discovers a secret way to win as a contestant on the game show `Press Your Luck.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: The story of British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: John Wayne won an Oscar here as Rooster Cogburn, a lawman recruited by a teenager seeking revenge on her fathers murderer.

programme.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
programme.desc: A conflicted Navy pilot and veteran of the Second World War questions the role he is forced to play when he is called back into service for the Korean War.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to become the most famous reggae musician in the world.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.
